scenarios.name: Successful Login and Creation of a Basic Task Assigned to a Single User
scenarios.description: This end-to-end scenario verifies that a user can successfully log in, select a company, navigate to the Tasks page, and create a single task with a name, due date, and assign it to one existing team member.
user_journey: Navigate to the application base URL.
Enter a valid email address from the Excel file.
Click the Continue button.
Enter the corresponding valid password from the Excel file.
Click the Login button.
Wait for the company selection page and click on the correct company name.
From the dashboard, click on the 'Action Items' menu.
Click on the 'Tasks' submenu option to navigate to the Manage Tasks page.
Click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' from the Excel file.
Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' field, enter a single, valid user email.
Wait for the autocomplete dropdown and click the matching user to select them.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
acceptance_criteria: User is successfully authenticated and navigated to the Manage Tasks page.
The 'New Task' form opens and accepts all valid inputs.
The specified user is successfully found and assigned to the task.
The task is created successfully upon clicking 'Save'.
The application returns to the Manage Tasks page, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.
test_data_requirements: A valid user email and password.
A valid company name associated with the user.
A unique task name.
A future due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
An email address of a single, existing team member in the system.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Users' Bulk Assignment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the successful creation of a task that is assigned to all users in the company using the 'Assign to all Users' bulk assignment checkbox.
user_journey: Assuming the user is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name'.
Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
Scroll down and locate the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox.
Click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.
The task is created and saved without errors.
The application returns to the Manage Tasks page after task creation.
test_data_requirements: A unique task name.
A future due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
The 'Assigned_To' field in the Excel data should contain 'Assign to all Users'.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Admins' and Optional Alignments
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the successful creation of a task assigned to all administrators, and also aligned to a pre-existing Priority and a pre-existing Huddle.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name'.
Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
Scroll down and click the 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox to select it.
Scroll to the Priority alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field.
Enter the name of a pre-existing Priority.
Wait for the dropdown and click the matching Priority to select it.
Scroll to the Huddle alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field.
Enter the name of a pre-existing Huddle.
Wait for the dropdown and click the matching Huddle to select it.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox is successfully selected.
The specified Priority is successfully found and selected from the dropdown.
The specified Huddle is successfully found and selected from the dropdown.
The task is created successfully with all specified assignments and alignments.
test_data_requirements: A unique task name.
A future due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
The 'Assigned_To' field in the Excel data should contain 'Assign to all Admins'.
The name of a Priority that already exists in the system.
The name of a Huddle that already exists in the system.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'File' Type Document Attachment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can create a task and successfully attach a document by uploading a local file.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
In the document upload dialog, enter the 'Document Name'.
Enter the 'Document_Description'.
Ensure the document type is 'File'.
Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full path to an existing local file.
Wait for the file upload to complete.
Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Wait for the dialog to close and the document to appear as attached.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document upload dialog opens successfully.
The document name and description are entered correctly.
The specified local file is successfully uploaded and attached to the task.
The task is created with the document attached.
The application returns to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique task name and a valid due date.
A document name and description.
The 'Document_Type' field must be 'File'.
The 'Document_File' field must contain the name of a file that exists at the 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'Link' Type Document Attachment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can create a task and successfully attach a document by providing a URL.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
In the document upload dialog, enter the 'Document Name'.
Enter the 'Document_Description'.
Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Wait for the dialog to close and the document link to appear as attached.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document upload dialog opens successfully.
The document name and description are entered correctly.
The 'Link' document type is selected and the URL is accepted.
The document link is successfully saved and attached to the task.
The task is created with the document link attached.
test_data_requirements: A unique task name and a valid due date.
A document name and description.
The 'Document_Type' field must be 'Link'.
The 'Document_URL' field must contain a validly formatted URL.

scenarios.name: Successful Data-Driven Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the system's ability to process multiple rows from an Excel file, creating each task sequentially within the same user session without logging out and back in.
user_journey: The test starts by reading all task data from the Excel file.
For the first task row: Execute the full login, company selection, and navigation to the Tasks page.
Create the first task according to its data.
For the second task row: Verify the application is still on the Manage Tasks page.
Create the second task according to its data without re-logging in.
Continue this process for all subsequent rows in the Excel file.
After the last task is created, close the browser.
acceptance_criteria: The user logs in only once at the beginning of the test run.
Each task defined in the Excel file is created successfully in sequence.
The user session remains active throughout the entire process.
The test completes without any session-related errors.
test_data_requirements: An Excel file containing at least two distinct task definitions, each with all necessary valid data (Task_Name, Due_Date, Assigned_To, etc.).
The first row must contain valid login credentials and company name.

dependencies: The test environment and application server must be stable and accessible.
Valid user credentials with appropriate permissions must be provided in the test data.
All individual users specified for assignment must pre-exist in the target company.
All Priorities and Huddles specified for alignment must pre-exist in the target company.
For file uploads, the specified files must exist at the configured 'File_Upload_Base_Path' on the test execution machine.
edge_cases: Creating a task with a due date on the last day of a leap year (e.g., 02/29/2028).
Successfully uploading a file with special characters or spaces in its name.
Creating a task where the task name is at the maximum allowed character limit.
Assigning a task to a user whose email address is very long.
